Test Scenario: Verify category grid page loads correctly
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to /tools/knowledge
2. Observe page load
3. Verify all 5 categories display
4. Check video counts appear
Expected Result:
1. Page loads within 2 seconds
2. All 5 category cards visible: Leadership, AI Works, Health, Entertaining, Human Philosophy
3. Each card shows correct video count
4. Icons render properly
5. Cards are clickable

Test Steps:
1. Click on 'Leadership' category card
2. Observe page navigation
3. Verify URL change
Expected Result:
1. Navigates to /tools/knowledge/leadership
2. Video list page loads
3. Breadcrumb shows: Home > Knowledge > Leadership

Test Steps:
1. Observe default view (grid)
2. Click 'List View' button
3. Observe layout change
4. Click 'Grid View' button
Expected Result:
1. Default shows grid layout (2-3 columns)
2. List view shows single column with thumbnails
3. Toggle buttons highlight active state
4. Video data remains the same

Preconditions: User is on video list page with 10+ videos
Test Steps:
1. Type 'AI' in search box
2. Observe results filter in real-time
3. Clear search
4. Verify all videos return
Expected Result:
1. Only videos with 'AI' in title/description show
2. Filtering happens without page reload
3. 'No results' message if no match
4. Clearing search shows all videos again

Preconditions: User is on video list page
Test Steps:
1. Click on first video card
2. Observe page load
3. Verify all components render
Expected Result:
1. Navigates to /tools/knowledge/[category]/[slug]
2. YouTube player loads and is playable
3. Video title and metadata display
4. Transcript section is collapsible
5. Related videos sidebar shows (max 5)

Preconditions: User is on video detail page
Test Steps:
1. Click play on video player
2. Adjust volume
3. Toggle fullscreen
4. Verify controls work
Expected Result:
1. Video plays without errors
2. Volume controls work
3. Fullscreen mode works
4. YouTube branding appears
5. No CORS or embed errors

Preconditions: User is on video detail page with transcript
Test Steps:
1. Observe transcript default state (collapsed)
2. Click 'Show more' button
3. Observe full transcript
4. Click 'Show less'
Expected Result:
1. Shows first 500 characters by default
2. 'Show more' expands to full text
3. Scrollbar appears if content is long
4. 'Show less' collapses back

Preconditions: User is on video detail page
Test Steps:
1. Scroll to 'Related Videos' section
2. Verify videos display
3. Click on a related video
Expected Result:
1. Shows up to 5 related videos
2. Same category as current video
3. Current video is excluded
4. Clicking navigates to that video page

Test Steps:
1. Open /tools/knowledge on mobile
2. Verify category cards stack
3. Navigate to video list
4. Verify single column layout
Expected Result:
1. Category grid shows 1 column
2. Cards are full width
3. Touch targets are adequate (min 44px)
4. No horizontal scroll
5. Player is responsive

Test Steps:
1. Click 'AI Tools' in main navigation
2. Verify destination
Expected Result:
1. Navigates to /tools/knowledge (not /tools/youtube)
2. Link is active/highlighted when on knowledge pages

Test Scenario: Verify review modal opens after upload
Preconditions: Admin logged in on /admin/dashboard Documents tab
Test Steps:
1. Drag or select a PDF file (<20MB)
2. Wait for upload to complete
3. Observe modal appearance
Expected Result:
1. Upload progress indicator shows
2. Review modal opens automatically after upload
3. Modal shows document metadata (filename, size, word count)
4. Modal shows extracted text in editable textarea
5. Shows first 5 chunks preview
6. Shows cost estimate

Test Scenario: Verify text editing in review modal
Preconditions: Review modal is open with document
Test Steps:
1. Click in the extracted text area
2. Edit some text (fix typos, add content)
3. Observe character count update
Expected Result:
1. Text area is editable
2. Changes are visible in real-time
3. Word count updates dynamically
4. Chunk preview reflects changes if at start of doc

Test Steps:
1. Observe 'Chunk Preview' section
2. Scroll through chunks
3. Verify formatting
Expected Result:
1. Shows first 5 chunks
2. Each chunk has index number (0-4)
3. Text is readable (not cut off mid-word)
4. Shows total chunk count (e.g., 'Showing 5 of 23 chunks')

Test Steps:
1. Locate cost estimate section
2. Verify calculation
3. Upload different sized docs to compare
Expected Result:
1. Shows estimated cost in USD format ($0.0001)
2. Formula: (chunks √ó 500 / 1000) √ó $0.00002
3. Cost updates if text is edited and word count changes

Preconditions: Review modal open with unedited document
Test Steps:
1. Click 'Approve' button
2. Wait for processing
3. Verify success message
4. Check document status
Expected Result:
1. Loading indicator appears
2. Success message: 'Document approved and added to Pinecone'
3. Modal closes
4. Document status = 'approved' in list
5. Document appears in chatbot knowledge

Preconditions: Review modal open, text has been edited
Test Steps:
1. Edit document text (add/remove content)
2. Click 'Approve' button
3. Wait for processing
4. Verify re-chunking
Expected Result:
1. System re-chunks the edited text
2. New chunk count may differ from original
3. Embeddings generated for new chunks
4. Document saved with edited text
5. Success message appears
Test Data: Edit: Change 500 words, add new paragraph

Test Steps:
1. Click 'Reject' button
2. Verify confirmation (if any)
3. Check document status
Expected Result:
1. Modal closes immediately
2. Message: 'Document rejected'
3. Document status = 'rejected'
4. Document NOT added to Pinecone
5. Document visible in admin list with red badge

Preconditions: Review modal open with edited text
Test Steps:
1. Edit document text
2. Click 'Save Draft' button
3. Re-open document from list
Expected Result:
1. Success message: 'Draft saved successfully'
2. Modal closes
3. Document status = 'draft'
4. Re-opening shows edited text (not original)
5. Changes are persisted

Test Steps:
1. Click 'X' close button or click outside modal
2. Verify document status
Expected Result:
1. Modal closes
2. Document remains in 'draft' status
3. No embeddings generated
4. Can re-open document later for review

Test Scenario: Verify API returns correct preview data
Test Steps:
1. Upload document via API
2. Inspect response JSON
Expected Result:
1. Response includes: extractedText, chunks (first 5), totalChunks, costEstimate
2. extractedText is full text string
3. chunks is array of 5 strings
4. costEstimate is number format

Test Scenario: Verify admin link hidden when logged out
Preconditions: User NOT logged in, on homepage
Test Steps:
1. Observe main navigation
2. Check for 'Admin' link
Expected Result:
1. Navigation shows: Home, About, Projects, Blog, AI Tools, Contact
2. 'Admin' link is NOT visible
3. No broken link placeholders

Test Scenario: Verify admin link visible when logged in
Test Steps:
1. Complete login at /admin/login
2. Navigate to homepage
3. Observe navigation
Expected Result:
1. Navigation includes 'Admin' link
2. Link appears after 'Contact'
3. Clicking navigates to /admin/dashboard
4. Link is highlighted when on admin pages

Test Steps:
1. Observe 'Admin' link styling
2. Navigate to home page
3. Navigate back to admin
Expected Result:
1. Admin link has primary color when active
2. Link returns to normal color on other pages
3. Active state works for all /admin/* routes

Test Steps:
1. Drag a file over upload zone (don't drop yet)
2. Observe visual changes
3. Drag file away
4. Observe reset
Expected Result:
1. Zone border changes to solid blue
2. Background becomes light blue (primary-50)
3. Cursor shows copy icon
4. Leaving zone resets to default gray dashed border

Test Steps:
1. Drag PDF file into upload zone
2. Drop file
3. Wait for upload
Expected Result:
1. Visual feedback shows (blue highlight)
2. Upload starts immediately after drop
3. Loading spinner appears
4. Review modal opens after processing
5. Success flow same as file input upload

Test Scenario: Verify file type validation on drag-drop
Test Steps:
1. Drag an invalid file type (.jpg, .png, .zip)
2. Drop file
3. Observe error
Expected Result:
1. Error alert: 'Invalid file type. Please upload PDF, DOCX, or TXT files.'
2. Upload does NOT proceed
3. Zone returns to default state
4. No API call made

Test Scenario: Verify file size validation on drag-drop
Test Steps:
1. Drag file >20MB
2. Drop file
3. Observe error
Expected Result:
1. Error message appears
2. Upload blocked
3. User informed of 20MB limit

Test Scenario: Verify upload during drag state disabled
Test Steps:
1. Start dragging file
2. Attempt to interact with other UI
3. Drop file
Expected Result:
1. Upload zone accepts interaction
2. Other buttons remain functional
3. No broken state if user changes mind

Test Steps:
1. Upload file via file input (click)
2. Upload file via drag-drop
3. Compare results
Expected Result:
1. Both methods open review modal
2. Same data structure returned
3. Same validation rules apply
4. Same user experience

Test Steps:

3. Hover over other cards
4. Move mouse away
Expected Result:

2. Tooltip text: 'Total number of documents across all statuses' (for Total)
3. Each card has unique helpful text
4. Tooltip disappears on mouse leave
5. Dark background, white text, readable

Test Steps:

2. Observe tooltip
3. Hover over badges in different statuses
Expected Result:
1. Tooltip shows: 'Status: draft' (or current status)
2. Positioned near badge
3. Doesn't overlap other UI elements
4. Readable on all status colors

Test Steps:

2. Hover over element at bottom
3. Hover near screen edges

Test Steps:
1. Run: npm run scrape https://example.com
2. Observe console output
3. Check output file
Expected Result:
1. Script shows: 'Fetching content from...'
2. Shows character count
3. Creates scraped-content.txt
4. File contains readable text (no HTML tags)

Test Scenario: Verify scrape script with custom output
Test Steps:
1. Run: npm run scrape https://example.com -o custom.txt
2. Check file created
Expected Result:
1. Creates custom.txt (not default name)
2. Contains scraped content
3. Overwrites if file exists

Test Steps:
1. Run: npm run scrape https://blog.com -s '.article-content'
2. Compare output with full page scrape
Expected Result:
1. Output contains only selected element content
2. Other page content (header, footer) excluded
3. Falls back to full page if selector not found

Test Steps:
1. Run npm test
2. Review which functions tested
Expected Result:
1. Tests cover: chunkText function
2. Tests: empty input, short text, long text, special chars, newlines
3. All tests passing

Test Steps:
1. Visit /tools/knowledge
2. Browse videos
3. Play a video
4. Ask chatbot about video topic
5. Login as admin
6. Upload related document
7. Approve document
8. Test chatbot with new knowledge
Expected Result:
1. All pages load correctly
2. Video plays in detail page
3. Chatbot responds with video knowledge
4. Admin login works
5. Document uploads and review modal works
6. Chatbot can answer questions from new document
7. No errors in console

Test Steps:
1. Navigate through all pages
2. Monitor network tab
3. Check page load times
4. Verify Lighthouse score
Expected Result:
1. Homepage loads <2 seconds
2. Video list page <3 seconds
3. No failed API requests
4. Images lazy load properly
5. Lighthouse score >90 for performance
